sources.full: Delvebound: The Unofficial Elder Scrolls Tabletop Roleplaying Game

condition.name: Bleeding
entries: A bleeding creature takes 6 ({@dice 1d10}) necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns at the start of each of its turns.
When the bleeding creature restores hit points, they receive half the amount of hit points they would normally receive.

The effect ends if a creature receives magical healing, uses a healer’s kit, or if a creature uses an action to make a Willpower ({@skill Medicine}) check made to staunch the wound (DC equal 10 + the number of rounds that the creature has bled, to a maximum of 15)
Creatures that are immune to necrotic damage are immune to this condition.

condition.name: Burning
entries: A burning creature starts on fire, taking 6 ({@dice 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.
A burning creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls and Attribute checks.
A burning creature sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light in an additional 10 feet.
The effect ends when a creature takes an action to douse the fire.
A creature that is immune to fire damage is immune to this condition.

condition.name: Camouflaged
entries: A camouflaged creature is difficult to see without the aid of magic or a special sense. For the purpose of Hiding, the creature is {@variantrule lightly obscured|xphb}. The creature’s location can be detected by any noise it makes or any tracks it leaves behind.
A camouflaged creature gains a +5 bonus on Agility ({@skill Stealth}) checks it makes to hide.
While a camouflaged creature is in {@variantrule Dim Light|xphb} or {@variantrule Darkness|xphb}, attack rolls against the creature have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}.

condition.name: Chilled
entries: A chilled creature’s speed is reduced by half.
The creature makes Agility saving throws with {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}.
The creature can’t take reactions.
A creature that is immune to cold damage is immune to this condition.

condition.name: Dazed
entries: A dazed creature’s speed is reduced to 5 feet, as it merely stumbles in its attempt to move.
The creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls, Agility saving throws, and Attribute checks.
The creature can’t concentrate on a spell while dazed.
A creature that is immune to the {@condition stunned} condition is immune to this condition.

condition.name: Frenzied
entries: A frenzied creature cannot distinguish friend from foe, is hostile to all creatures, and attacks the nearest creature that it can see. If there are two creatures within equal distance, the GM chooses which creature it attacks at random.
While frenzied, the creature makes all attack rolls with {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}, but attack rolls against it also have advantage.
A frenzied creature can’t be {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, or {@condition rallied|D:UESTTRPG}.

A frenzied creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on any attribute check to interact socially with another creature that does not rely on Personality ({@skill Intimidation}), and can speak only falteringly.
The creature can’t concentrate on a spell while frenzied.
A creature that is immune to the charmed condition is immune to this condition.

condition.name: Frozen
entries: A frozen creature is frozen into solid ice, along with any objects it's wearing or carrying. Its weight increases by a factor of 3 and no longer ages.
The creature is {@condition incapacitated}, can't move or speak, and is unaware of its surroundings.
Attack rolls against the creature have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.
The creature automatically fails Strength and Agility saving throws.
The creature has vulnerability to bludgeoning damage, and has resistance to all other damage except psychic.
The creature is immune to poison and disease. If the creature is already poisoned or diseased, the effects are suspended until the condition ends.
A creature that is immune to the {@condition restrained} condition is immune to this condition.

condition.name: Hysterical
entries: A hysterical creature can’t concentrate on spells or form coherent thoughts.
All Personality checks to speak to or console the creature automatically fail.
The creature can speak only falteringly, scream, or laugh uncontrollably.
A creature that is immune to the {@condition frightened} condition is immune to this condition.
A hysterical creature’s actions are determined by rolling a d10 at the beginning of its turns:

rows: The creature drops all held items and uses its action to take the {@action Dash} action to flee from all other creatures.
The creature cowers and is unable to move or take actions this turn..
The creature uses its action to take the {@action Dodge} action and doesn’t move.
Until the start of its next turn, the creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on saving throws and is {@condition frightened} of all other creatures.
The creature uses its reaction to make a melee attack against a creature that enters into its reach before the start of its next turn.

condition.name: Intoxicated
entries: An intoxicated creature is {@condition poisoned}.
The creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Endurance, Agility, and Intelligence saving throws.
The creature automatically fails Willpower ({@skill Insight}) checks.
Personality checks are made with {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} against an intoxicated creature.
To cast a spell, the creature must first succeed on a DC 10 Endurance check. Otherwise, the Cast a Spell action is wasted, but the magicka to produce the spell isn't expended.
A creature that is immune to the poisoned condition is immune to this condition.

condition.name: Rallied
entries: A rallied creature can’t be {@condition charmed}, {@condition frenzied|D:UESTTRPG}, or {@condition frightened} while the source of its inspiration is within line of sight.
A rallied creature can take a bonus action to move up to half of its speed towards a hostile creature.
The creature can use its reaction to re-roll a failed saving throw, and must use the result of the new roll.

condition.name: Staggered
entries: A staggered creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Strength and Agility saving throws.
On its turn, it can use either an action or a bonus action, not both. Regardless of the creature’s abilities or magic items, it can’t make more than one melee or ranged attack during its turn.
A creature that is immune to the {@condition prone} condition is immune to this condition.

condition.name: Weakened
entries: The amount of damage dealt from attacks and spells by the weakened creature is reduced by half.
The creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Strength and Endurance saving throws and attribute checks.
The amount of weight the creature can carry, push, drag, or lift is halved.
A creature that is immune to the {@condition exhausted} condition is immune to this condition.
